snippet: The British prime minister, David Cameron, apologized for the handling of the 1989 Hillsborough stadium disaster, where 96 people died, after a new report cited failures and cover-ups by authorities.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron apologizes for the handling of the 1989 Hillsborough stadium disaster, where 96 Liverpool soccer fans were crushed to death, after a new report cites failures and cover-ups by authorities; apology and inquiry panel findings mark a stunning reversal in a saga that has been an open wound in Britain.
lead_paragraph: The British prime minister, David Cameron, apologized for the handling of the 1989 Hillsborough stadium disaster, where 96 people died, after a new report cited failures and cover-ups by authorities.

headline.seo: British Government Apologizes for Blaming Victims in 1989 Hillsborough Disaster
headline.main: 23 Years After Soccer Tragedy, an Apology and a Shift in Blame
headline.print_headline: 23 Years After Soccer Tragedy, An Apology and a Shift in Blame
